Pre-Game Insights: The Orlando Magic will be without their top four scorers — Paolo Banchero, Franz Wagner, Jalen Suggs and Moe Wagner — and a reserve three-and-D guard (Gary Harris).
Anthony Black is listed as questionable.
The Magic will have, at most, 11 players available.
The 8-25 Jazz are one of five NBA teams yet to surpass 10 wins.
The Jazz furthered the Miami Heat's disarray with a 36-point drubbing.
The Magic have the third-best home record in the NBA, after Cleveland and Oklahoma City.
The slate of games following Utah isn't easy: New York on Monday for the second half of a back-to-back, then back in Orlando to face Minnesota, Milwaukee and Philadelphia.
Despite their injuries, the Magic have stayed afloat in the East's top four.
Consecutive losses from the Knicks have shrunk the gap between the two rivals.
